title: India's solar sector set for first shakeout as capacity balloons – Nikkei Asia
description: Read about the promising future of India’s solar industry, driven by massive growth in rooftop installations and ambitious expansion plans.
content:
Background

India's solar sector is set for its first major shakeout as the country aims to scale up capacity significantly in 2023. The Indian government has unveiled ambitious plans to increase national electricity production by 6 GW over the next five years, driven primarily by a surge of rooftop solar installations and large-scale utility projects. This growth is anticipated to reshape the entire industry landscape.

Rooftop Solar Installations Surge India recorded an unprecedented year in its rooftop solar installations, increasing 123% YoY to reach 7.1 GW in 2025. This substantial rise underscores growing consumer interest and technological advancements that have made solar power more accessible and cost-effective.

Utility Scale Projects Elevate the Industry The government's push towards renewables has accelerated the growth of large-scale utility projects, aiming for capacity levels exceeding 40 GW by 2030. These ambitious targets are expected to drive significant investment in solar technology and infrastructure development across various states.

Industry Impact

Analysis of Broad Implications

India’s solar sector is poised for a period of unprecedented growth as the country aims to achieve its national electrification target within the next few years. The surge in installations, coupled with aggressive utility-scale expansion plans, will push the industry into new territories.

Expert Perspective

Experts predict that the rapid advancements in technology and innovative business models are likely to further accelerate this momentum. Companies and investors must stay vigilant as the market conditions evolve, ensuring they position themselves for future growth opportunities.

What This Means

For India's solar companies, the coming years will be defined by a dynamic landscape where technological innovations and regulatory support play pivotal roles in shaping their strategies. Consumers' increasing awareness of environmental issues and accessibility to renewable energy sources are driving significant demand, creating ample business opportunities that cannot be ignored.

Looking Ahead

The industry is set to witness continuous expansion as both the government and private sector invest heavily in solar projects. As 2023 progresses, expect more comprehensive developments across various states, which will likely culminate in a significant increase in total installed capacity and economic benefits for the country.

Future Outlook and Predictions

India's ambitious goals of doubling its renewable energy production by 2030 are expected to continue driving market growth. This trajectory suggests that India’s solar sector is well-positioned to become a global leader in renewables, contributing significantly to achieving national targets while leading the world in clean energy adoption.
